subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






May 3, 2007


                              		
                              		
                              	  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video



                              	
                              	  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation






TOP STORIESQueen Elizabeth II Arrives In Virginia
Queen Elizabeth II and her husband, Prince Philip, stepped off a chartered airplane in Richmond, Va., signaling the beginning
                        of a six-day American trip. It is her first visit to the United States in 16 years.  More...Watch: U.S. Rolls Out Royal Carpet
• Space Pioneer Wally Schirra Dies At 84• Iraq Lawmakers Get Heat For Vacation Plans
                     					| Watch• House Votes To Expand Hate Crimes LawU.S.30 Injured In Pennsylvania Bus Crash
A bus carrying musicians and their band director to a competition on the Jersey Shore rear-ended a tractor-trailer that was
                        going much more slowly. Most of the injuries were minor, but the bus driver is in critical condition. More...
• Padilla Jurors Cite Lack Of Trust On 9/11• Space Pioneer Wally Schirra Dies At 84• Hiker Dies Of Thirst With Water All Around• More StoriesWorldRice Talks Iraq With Top Syrian Official
Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice met with Syria's foreign minister in the first high-level talks in years between the two
                        countries. Rice said the meeting was "professional and businesslike" and was focused on how to improve security in Iraq. More...Watch: Rice Talks With Iraqi PM
• Providing Aid For Darfur Isn't Easy
                     					| Watch• Thousands Of Israelis Want PM To Quit• Scots Hit Polls For Historic Election• More StoriesPoliticsWhat Motivates Fred Thompson?
What's actor/politician Fred Thompson's motivation to play the real-life role of president of the United States? And Barack
                        Obama delivers some "tough love" on the campaign trail. Joel Roberts has the highlights of the day's headlines. More...Watch: Bush: 'We Can Work Together'
• Wolfowitz Defends Actions At World Bank• Rice Talks Iraq With Top Syrian Official
                     					| Watch• House Votes To Expand Hate Crimes Law• More StoriesHealthMore Pet Foods Added To Recall List
Menu Foods expanded its recall of pet food products in the United States and Canada because of possible cross-contamination
                        between melamine-tainted products and other foods made in the same period. More...Watch: Human Food Supply In Jeopardy?
• Study: Many Factors In Breast Cancer Drop• Once-A-Year Drug May Thwart Bone Fractures
                     					| Watch• Study: 1 In 4 Kids Go Without Health Care
                     					| Watch• More StoriesSciTechArctic Melt-Off Is Ahead Of Schedule
As environmental scientists gather in Bangkok, a new study shows that one of the group's earlier predictions on climate change
                        may already be too conservative. More...
• Space Pioneer Wally Schirra Dies At 84• Myths Abound About U.S. Bee Disappearance• Digg Reverses Course After Online Uproar• More StoriesBusinessHow Much Is Mom Worth?
Salary.com says the answer is $138,000 a year for stay-at-homes, $85,000 over and above their wages for working mothers. Much
                        of that is overtime. More...
• Save On Admissions To Amusement Parks• Imus Reportedly Plans To Sue CBS• GM 1Q Profit Down 90 Percent From 2006• More StoriesEntertainmentParis Faces 45 Days In The Slammer
In documents filed April 30 in Superior Court, prosecutors said they want Paris Hilton to be required to stay away from alcohol
                        for 90 days and wear a monitoring device that will chart whether she complies. More...
• Britney Does It Again 
                     					| Watch• Beckham Celebrates B-Day In London• Witness In Spector Case Suggests Tampering
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionFirings Firestorm Won't Die Down Soon
As the U.S. attorney scandal rolls into the summer, CBSNews.com legal analyst Andrew Cohen says the people who should
                        have been fired did the firing and those who should continue to serve the public got the shaft. More...
• Rupert Riles Reds! Repubs Rejoice!
                     					| Watch• Fixing Iraq Through Gridlock
                     					| Watch• Dangerous Distractions
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Recipes: Easy Spring Delights From Top Chef
Marcus Samuelsson shared recipes for lamb, tuna, salads and more on The Early Show. He also discussed the anniversary
                        of a foundation that hands out prestigious awards, including one to "rising star chefs." He won one, back in 1999. More...

                                    hanging out together.
